instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: 820 00165 not turning on
threads.message:
I have a macbook air with this main board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Laptop was liquid damaged. It is not turning on. Green and orange charger light is present.
Fan spin for about 1 second then stop.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.63v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 15v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.43v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.45v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.42v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.33
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> 3.33v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 3.44v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0v
<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> 3.33v


thanks

threads.title: 820 00165 not turning on
threads.message: Check for power pulsing at <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>, best to use scope as pulses are hard to catch on multimeter. And of course check for corrosions <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and the termination resistors/traces and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8.
